title.narrative: One Cordaid DRC against COVID-19

description.narrative:
Overall objective: to help curb the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic in DRC. Specific objectives:
- Strengthening risk communication and the participation and commitment of local communities through RECO and local radios, in order to ensure that they take ownership of community activities to prevent and respond to a possible coronavirus epidemic and that these activities are taken into account across all the pillars of the response. - Supporting victims from domestic and sexual violence. - Strengthening the coordination of community activities in each targeted health zones.

Since the outbreak of Coronavirus (COVID-19) in Wuhan, China, the global public health threat posed by COVID-19 is high, with more than 1,400,000 reported cases worldwide. The DRC Ministry of Health confirmed the first case of COVID-19 in the DRC on March 10, 2020. The DRC President decided enhanced screening, quarantine measures and movement restrictions to reduce the spread of COVID-19, along with recommended basic protective measures (hand-washing and social distancing). However, DRC is a vast country, with more than 80 million inhabitants leaving in dire conditions. The health system is weak and will not be able to handle a major health crisis. Many people don’t have access to clean water, stay together in small spaces and live from hand-to-mouth. In addition, a health crisis could rapidly turn into a social crisis, as the informal sector accounts for more than 80% of the economy. Faced with the spread of this epidemic in DRC, it is urgent to sensitize populations to raise awareness of the danger posed by this disease and to respect the recommendations of the health authorities for proper prevention against the pandemic.
As a result, prevention and preparedness are key to prevent from a global crisis in DRC.
Target groups – RECO, health care providers, community leaders, local civil society organizations (especially youth organizations), local authorities

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH
